intro.p: Below you will find two tables of numerical summaries of different datasets. Use these tables to answer the questions below. Answer all questions completely and include contextual information in your answers. Show or explain all of your work.

Poverty, disease, hunger, climate change, war, existential risks, and inequality: The world faces many great and terrifying problems. It is these large problems that our work at Our World in Data focuses on. Our World in Data is a non-profit that has as its mission to make the knowledge on the big problems accessible and understandable. The information below are the child mortality rates for countries around the world in the year 2020 for which data is available, split by male vs female children.
Male Child Mortality Rates by Country

p.me: \begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|} \hline \text{ N } &\text{ Min } &\text{ Q1 } &\text{ Median } &\text{ Q3 } &\text{ Max } &\text{ Mean } &\text{ St Dev } \\ \hline \text{ {{n_1}} } & {{min_1}} & {{q1_1}} & {{med_1}} & {{q3_1}} & {{max_1}} & {{mean_1}} & {{stdev_1}} \\ \hline \end{array}

intro.p: Female Child Mortality Rates by Country

p.me: \begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|} \hline \text{ N } &\text{ Min } &\text{ Q1 } &\text{ Median } &\text{ Q3 } &\text{ Max } &\text{ Mean } &\text{ St Dev } \\ \hline \text{ {{n_2}} } & {{min_2}} & {{q1_2}} & {{med_2}} & {{q3_2}} & {{max_2}} & {{mean_2}} & {{stdev_2}} \\ \hline \end{array}

content.p: What is the {{min_max}} that a {{sex_1}} child mortality rate for a country could be and still be {{dir_1}} than the {{sex_1}} child mortality rate of {{percent_1}} of the other countries in the dataset? Explain your answer.
The dataset for {{sex_2}} child mortality rates has a quartile {{quar_2}} of {{change_2}}. Explain what this means in terms of the countries in the dataset and their {{sex_2}} child mortality rates.

outtro.p: In 2020, {{percent_2}} of the countries in the dataset had a {{sex_2}} child mortality of {{change_2}} or less.

content.p: What would happen to the {{stand_mean}} of the dataset for female child mortality rates if an additional point was added at or {{dir_3}}? Explain your answer.
Find and interpret the Z-score for a Male child mortality rate of {{za}} (round to 2 decimal places)
Find and interpret the Z-score for a Female child mortality rate of {{zb}} (round to 2 decimal places)
Create boxplots for each of the numerical summaries given above. (use the IQR to determine your wiskers)
Based on the min and max of the data sets do you think there are any outliers in either of these data sets? Explain your reasoning.

outtro.p: The bounds for Males is ({{lb_1}},{{ub_1}}) the bounds for Females is({{lb_2}},{{ub_2}})

content.p: Describe the shape of the distribution of the {{sex_5}} child mortality rates. Use evidence from your boxplots above to justify your answer.
